California Molly Malone’s Irish Pub reopens after fire Molly Malone’s on Fairfax Ave. has been a St. Patrick’s Day institution for the past 57 years. But last June, a fire scorched the pub’s facade, forcing an 8-month closure. After months of dedicated work, the beloved bar reopened—just in time for this year’s St. Patrick’s Day celebration. By Tom Carroll Video Journalist Follow March 17, 2025 5:01 PM PT Share via Close extra sharing options Email Facebook X LinkedIn Threads Reddit WhatsApp Copy Link URL Copied! Print Tom Carroll swung by at 10 AM to see how many folks “called in sick” to keep the tradition alive. California Tom Carroll Follow Us X Instagram TikTok Email Tom Carroll is a content creator for the Los Angeles Times. Before joining The Times in 2022, he created, produced and hosted the web series “ Tom Explores Los Angeles .” He has produced stories for NPR and Gimlet. A fourth-generation Southern Californian, he is a graduate of Occidental College and the University of Southern California. Molly's Pub And Restaurant Shebeen | The Most Authentic Irish Bar in New York City 287 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10010 (212) 889-3361 info@mollysshebeennyc.com home about menus gallery contact HOME HOME ABOUT ABOUT MENUS MENUS GALLERY GALLERY CONTACT CONTACT INSTAGRAM INSTAGRAM The Most Authentic Irish Bar in New York City! "There Is Nothing Better On A Bright Sunny Summer's Day Than A Dark Irish Pub." Late-Night Menu available til 1 am âNew Yorkâs finest Irish pub.ââ Come for a pint, stay for the company ð» Join us for Lunch, Dinner & Weekend Brunch Most Popular Irish Bars in nyc "This is the place to go for authentic, traditional Irish cuisine such as shepherdâs pie or corned beef and cabbage" Best Irish Bars in nyc The 15 Best Irish Bars in NYC to Hit Up This St. Patrickâs Day Celebrities' Favorite Jimmy Fallon has been going to New York City's Molly's Pub on St. Patrick's Day for the past 20 years. Molly's Pub And Restaurant Shebeen, which stands at 287 Third Avenue, was first established as a bar in 1895. During Prohibition (1920-1933) it operated as a grocery store, and in the mid 1930s, following the repeal of Prohibition, the retail space once again began to serve alcohol and the buildingâs three upper floors became a rooming house for transient workers. The bar was constructed from Honduran mahogany which, together with the original wood- burning fireplace, is still in place today. In 1964 the business was purchased by the Purfield family from Dublin and Galway, designed by Stanley Franks in the Tudor style that exists today, and named Molly Maloneâs after a popular Irish folk song. In 1991, Molly Maloneâs was taken over by Peter OâConnell from Co Meath, who renamed it Mollyâs Shebeen (a shebeen is an illegal drinking establishment). In 1995 Peter was joined by John Ronaghan from Co Monaghan, and together they manage Mollyâs, serving traditional Irish and American pub fare to a loyal and much-appreciated Gramercy neighborhood. KITCHEN HOURS Sunday to Tuesday 11 am to 11 pm Wednesday to Saturday 11 am to Midnight BAR HOURS Monday to Sunday 11 am to 4 am BRUNCH Saturday & Sunday 11 am to 4 pm Mollyâs is one of my favorites. Itâs a great pub, their Guinness itâs a thing of beauty. I love it so much! Molly Malones – Irish Pub Skip to content About Book table Menu Opening Hours Happy Hours Molly Malones Stockholm’s best Irish Pub Boka bord Live Music About The Molly Malone statue is located in Suffolk Street, a short distance from Trinity College and Grafton Street. Molly Malone was a semi historical, semi-legendary figure who was commemorated in the song ‘Cockles and Mussels’, a Dublin anthem. As well as being known and sung internationally, the popular song ‘Cockles and Mussels’ has become a sort of unofficial anthem of Dublin City. The song’s tragic heroine Molly Malone and her barrow have come to stand as one of the most familiar symbols of the capital. Menu Below you will find our menu and drink list. For further questions, please contact us: 08-30 18 66. Download Menu Happy Hour Check our Happy Hour menu. Happy Hour Menu Opening Hours Tue-Sat 13:00-01:00 Sun-Mon 13:00-24:00 With reservation for other opening hours than above. Our dress code is smart, business or formal. Live Music Nick Enis – Friday 23 & Saturday 24 May Nick Enis – Wednesday 25 & Thursday 26 June Book a table Immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere of Molly Malone’s by booking your table today! Whether you’re planning a delightful evening with friends, a romantic date, or a special celebration, our dedicated team is ready to ensure an unforgettable experience. Planning a gathering with more than 10 people? We’d love to accommodate your group! Please give us a call or send us an email to arrange your booking. Our team is here to ensure your experience is seamless and enjoyable. Contact Molly Malones, an Irish Pub in the heart of Stockholm. Address: Odengatan 83, Stockholm, Phone: 08-30 18 66. info@mollymalone.se For job vacancies please contact: jobb@mollymalone.se Molly Malones, Odengatan 83, Stockholm For the latest news follow us on Instagram and Facebook Copyright 2025 © Molly Malones About Book Table Menu Opening Hours Happy Hours Login Username or email address * Password * Remember me Log in Lost your password?

Irish Pub & Restaurant Glyfada Athens – Molly Malones's Athens – Irish Pub & Restaurant in Glyfada Athens. Molly Malone's Irish Pub Restaurant provides you the best experience in drinks and food. HOME  | MENU  | NEWS-EVENTS  | Irish Pub & Restaurant... A new Taste Experience... Enjoy unique Drinks... Authentic GUINNESS... The best Irish Pub in Athens... A must Irish Pub... About us. Molly Malones was the first authentic Irish Pub to be established in Athens . It was opened in Glyfada Athens in December 2003 and quickly became one of the most popular venues in the South Eastern suburb of Athens. Come and enjoy our unique blend of good food and drink in friendly surroundings served by cheerful and welcoming staff.! “All major sporting events are shown on out large-screen televisions and if there is a particular football match or other event that you would like to see please ask one of the staff if it is available and we will do our best to find it for you.” Legend Irish music…Hit play! https://mollymalones.gr/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Saw-Doctors-Green-and-Red-of-Mayo-lyrics.mp3 . Take your pick of beer, wine, or other beverages offered on this restaurant's menu. Grab the kids when you head to this restaurant ? its family-oriented menu and ambience are perfect for the whole clan. Fridays are for fun! Come check out the vibe at Molly Malone's Irish Pub. Molly Malone's Irish Pub offers a free wifi hot spot ? perfect for surfing the web or getting a little work done. Wanna soak up the sun? Come grab a bite at Molly Malone's Irish Pub and sit out on their gorgeous patio. For those who love to shake it, hit the restaurant dance floor and show off some of your best moves. Prepare to face the crowds if you visit on the weekend ? Friday and Saturday are Molly Malone's Irish Pub's busiest days. No need for a wardrobe change when you hit Molly Malone's Irish Pub ? it's strictly casual. Meeting the gang for a movie? Pick up some food from this restaurant. Whether you are looking for street or lot parking, Molly Malone's Irish Pub is close to both. For those who prefer to travel by bike, Molly Malone's Irish Pub is a great option due to its generous bike parking options. Your tab at Molly Malone's Irish Pub will usually run to about $30 per guest. Molly Malone's Irish Pub is the kind of place where you can have a night out, enjoy a nice beer, and maybe make a friend or two. Inquire Now about parties About Us MOLLY MALONE'S IRISH PUB For over 56 years, Molly Malone’s has been a cornerstone of Los Angeles’ vibrant live music scene.
